results.title: Just like dad
results.brief_description: Gemma’s dad, an old rocker from way back, is passionate about music and anything and everything that is remotely connected to music. This addiction comes to a head when dad discovers Ebay on the home computer. Searches and purchases; Ebay has taken over his life. Worse still, Ebay the enemy is now growing on Gemma. She is her father’s daughter! Uses stills and animation.

group.title: Western stories: expressions for the future. [Vol. 1]

results.title: [Tony Agapitos: 3ZZ Protest March]
results.brief_description:
‘Protest March, Melbourne’ (circa 1975-77) shows a protest march in Melbourne in the mid-1970s in support of multi-lingual community radio station 3ZZ, with crowds gathering at City Square then marching up Swanston Street.

This film is part of a collection of 16mm films made by Tony Agapitos. The collection offers a glimpse at Greek migrant life in Victoria from the 1950s to the 1970s.

results.title: [John Robertson Duigan Film Collection: Reel 2]
results.brief_description:
The John Robertson Duigan Collection is a collection of silent 9.5mm home movies filmed by early aviator and engineer John Robertson Duigan (1882–1951). The collection includes a Pathé-Baby 9.5mm film camera and projector owned by Duigan. The home movies provide an insight into the everyday lives of John and his family in Victoria, including picnics, trips to the Grampians and Colac, family snapshots and aeroplanes of the late 1920s.

This short film, originally shot on 9.5mm film, features panoramic views of the Red Rock Lakes near Colac, Victoria. The film features shots of a man and child on a hill, with the man holding a film camera, and shots of Duigan’s brother, Reginald Duigan, and children outside a large house.

results.title: [Shetland mills]
results.brief_description: Rare print (not titles/credits) of Shetland Mills woollen factory in Melbourne in the early 1950s. Title and print have been withdrawn and print should only be viewed on a Steenbeck. (HG 20/01/06) Looks at a modern knitting mill in Melbourne circa 1950. Shows headquaters near the corner of Lonsdale and Bourke streets; workers arriving for work; delivering the yarn; lunch in the cafeteria; and workers operating equipment.

results.title: Patience
results.brief_description: A poetic tale of elusive love, of numbness and loss and being shut off from the outside world. Can love be found? An evocative work created through the use of black and white images and an ambient soundtrack.

results.title: Victoria: 100 years of progress
results.brief_description:
This documentary looks in detail at the history and development of Melbourne, using artist’s sketches and filmed footage to depict the history of Melbourne. Some items include the Manchester Unity Building, cars of the era travelling down St Kilda Road, St Kilda Beach, a brief history of the Princes Bridge, the Royal Botanic Gardens, Geelong and industries and transport existing in 1934. Also includes footage of the opening of Parliament.

Includes archival footage of early transport-cars; shipping; rail (Flinders Street Station); Prince’s Bridge; St. Kilda Beach; Anzac Parade; Flemington Race Course. Arrival of the Duke and Duchess of York for the first opening of Federal Parliament 1901. Also featured: scenes of the city: Collins and Swanston Streets; Melbourne Town Hill; The Exhibition Building; Parliament House and large private homes in the suburb of Toorak. Reference is made to agricultural and pastoral industries - wheat; wool production; fruit growing and tanning in Mildura. Three masted sailing vessels plus a farewell for the ocean liner Strathnaver. Finally, a re-enactment of gold mining/panning and heralding the first one hundredth birthday of the settlement of Melbourne
[SOURCE: NFSA Collection catalogue)

results.title: Media Education (TEFC)
results.brief_description: Children must learn to evaluate and understand the language of media forms. By actively participating in media studies classes, film making, role playing and newscasting, they learn to question what they see and read, and become more aware of good and bad production

results.title: The Road home
results.brief_description: One of the most dramatic stories from a young aspiring filmmaker with autism who lost everything - his home, his camera and film equipment. Starting to rebuild now and a strong family network.

results.title: Raga shadow
results.brief_description:
Please be advised: This film features flashing lights that may potentially trigger seizures for people with photosensitive epilepsy.

The Frank Eidlitz Collection contains the 16mm and 35mm film work of graphic designer and visual artist Frank Eidlitz (1923–1997), predominantly made during a Winston Churchill Fellowship at the Massachusetts Institute of Technology (MIT), Cambridge in 1966. The collection contains Eidlitz’s experiments with light, movement and technology in film.

This short film features Frank Eidlitz’s early experiments with light, colour and motion.

To create these visuals, Eidlitz covered a series of disks with pieces of reflective paper and fluorescent colours, which he then placed on an apparatus that spun the disks at a high speed. The motion could be varied and stopped at any time, allowing the artist to create varying designs and images.

This film opens with footage of a woman’s silhouette dancing, overlaid with flashing geometric shapes in red and green. The film then focuses on the woman’s face and subsequently the silhouette of her legs, exploring movement, shadow and light.
